parse.title: List of Holocaust memorials and museums

text.*:
A number of organizations, museums and monuments are intended to serve as memorials to the Holocaust, the Nazi Final Solution, and its millions of victims. They include:

Contents

  • 1 Argentina
  • 2 Australia
  • 3 Austria
    • 3.1 Vienna
    • 3.2 Other places
  • 4 Belarus
  • 5 Belgium
  • 6 Brazil
  • 7 Bulgaria
  • 8 Canada
  • 9 China (People's Republic of China)
  • 10 Croatia
  • 11 Czech Republic
  • 12 Estonia
  • 13 France
  • 14 Germany
  • 15 Greece
  • 16 Hungary
  • 17 Israel
  • 18 Italy
  • 19 Japan
  • 20 Latvia
  • 21 Macedonia
  • 22 Mexico
  • 23 Netherlands
  • 24 Norway
  • 25 Poland
  • 26 Russia
  • 27 Serbia
  • 28 Slovakia
  • 29 South Africa
  • 30 Spain
  • 31 Suriname
  • 32 Sweden
  • 33 Ukraine
  • 34 United Kingdom
  • 35 United States
  • 36 Uruguay
  • 37 See also
  • 38 Related
  • 39 Notes
  • 40 References
  • 41 External links

Argentina[edit]

  • Museo del Holocausto de Buenos Aires[1] (Holocaust Memorial Museum, Buenos Aires)

Australia[edit]

  • The Jewish Museum Holocaust and Research Centre (Melbourne, Victoria)[2]
  • Leo Baeck Centre for Progressive Judaism (Kew, Victoria) Holocaust Memorial[3]
  • Melbourne General Cemetery Holocaust Memorial (Parkville, Victoria)[4]
  • Sydney Jewish Museum[5] (Sydney, Australia)

Austria[edit]

Vienna[edit]

  • The Judenplatz Holocaust Memorial

Other places[edit]

  • Holocaust and Tolerance Center Styria, "House of Names" (Holocaust und Toleranzzentrum Steiermark, Haus der Namen)[6] (Graz)
  • House of Responsibility, Braunau am Inn
  • Mauthausen Concentration Camp Memorial,[7] (Mauthausen) programs: The Austrian Holocaust Memorial Service

Belarus[edit]

  • The Pit (Minsk)

Belgium[edit]

  • Kazerne Dossin: Memorial, Museum and Documentation Centre on Holocaust and Human Rights[8] (Mechelen)

Brazil[edit]

  • Holocaust victims memorial at Rio de Janeiro – Cemitério Israelita do Caju (sephardic) – inaugurated in September 1975
  • Holocaust victims memorial at Salvador – Cemitério Israelita da Bahia – inaugurated in 2007
  • Holocaust Museum in Curitiba – inaugurated in 2011 (Paraná)

Bulgaria[edit]

  • The Organization of the Jews in Bulgaria

Canada[edit]

  • Holocaust Memorial sculpture (Edmonton, Alberta)[9]
  • The Montreal Holocaust Museum (Montreal)
  • The National Holocaust Monument[10] (Ottawa, Ontario)
  • Sarah and Chaim Neuberger Holocaust Education Centre (Toronto)[11]
  • The Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre[12] (Vancouver, British Columbia)

China (People's Republic of China)[edit]

  • Hong Kong Holocaust and Tolerance Centre (香港大屠杀和宽容中心)[13] (Hong Kong)
  • Shanghai Jewish Refugees Museum (上海犹太难民纪念馆),[14] "Wall of Shanghai List" and Holocaust Memorial statue[15] (Shanghai)

Croatia[edit]

  • The Jasenovac Memorial Area (Jasenovac)
  • Memorial Centre Lipa Remembers (Lipa, Matulji)

Czech Republic[edit]

Names of Holocaust victims in the Pinkas Synagogue in Prague
Holocaust memorial in Valašské Meziříčí, Czech Republic
  • Holocaust memorial (Valašské Meziříčí)
  • Pinkas Synagogue (Prague)
  • Theresienstadt concentration camp (Terezín)

Estonia[edit]

  • Holocaust memorial at the site of Klooga concentration camp (Klooga)
  • Memorial at the site of Kalevi-Liiva (Jägala)

France[edit]

  • Musée départemental de Résistance et Déportation[16] (Agen)
  • Musée de la Résistance et de la Déportation (Charente)[17] (Angoulême)
  • Musée de la Résistance d'Anterrieux[18] (Anterrieux)
  • Centre de la résistance et de la déportation du Pays d'Arles[19] (Arles)
  • The Museum of the Resistance and Deportation (Besançon)
  • Musée de la Résistance, de la Déportation et de la Libération du Loir-et-Cher[20] (Blois)
  • Musée de la Résistance de Bondues au Fort Lobau (Nord)[21] (Bondues)
  • Centre Jean Moulin[22] (Bordeaux)
  • Musée de la Résistance et de la Déportation de Bourges et du Cher[23] (Bourges)
  • Centre National d'Etudes de la Résistance et de la Déportation Edmond Michelet[24] (Brive-la-Gaillarde)
  • Mémorial de Caen[25] (Caen)
  • Musée de la Résistance[26] (Castellane)
  • Centre régional de la Résistance et de la Déportation de Castelnau-le-Lez (Hérault)[27] (Castelnau-le-Lez)
  • Musée du souvenir de Châlons (Marne)[28] (Châlons-en-Champagne)
  • Musée de la Résistance, de l'Internement et de la Déportation de Chamalières[29] (Chamalières)
  • Musée de la Résistance Nationale de Champigny-sur-Marne[30] (Champigny-sur-Marne)
  • Musée de la Résistance de Châteaubriant-Voves-Rouillé[31] (Châteaubriant)
  • Mémorial du Vercors[32] (Vassieux-en-Vercors)
  • Mémorial Charles de Gaulle[33] (Colombey-les-Deux-Églises)
  • Mémorial de l'internement et de la déportation[34] (Compiègne)
  • Musée de la Résistance et de la Déportation[35] (Fargniers)
  • Musée Départemental de la Résistance et de la Déportation de Forges-les-Eaux[36] (Forges-les-Eaux)
  • Musée de la Résistance, de la Déportation et de la Seconde Guerre mondiale[37] (Frugières-le-Pin)
  • Musée de la Résistance et de la Déportation de l'Isère[38] (Grenoble)
  • Maison d'Izieu mémorial des enfants juifs exterminés[39] (Izieu)
  • Lieu de Mémoire au Chambon-sur-Lignon[40] (Le Chambon-sur-Lignon, Haute-Loire)
  • Musée départemental de la Résistance et de la Déportation (Loiret)[41] (Lorris)
  • Centre d'histoire de la résistance et de la déportation[42] (Lyon)
  • Musée de la Résistance et de la Déportation (Tarn-et-Garonne)[43] (Montauban)
  • Musée Bourbonnais de la Résistance Nationale (Allier)[44] (Montluçon)
  • Musée de l'Histoire vivante (Montreuil)
  • Musée de la Résistance et de la Déportation[44] (Nantua)
  • Musée de la Résistance Henri Queuille (Corrèze)[45] (Neuvic)
  • Centre de recherche et d'étude azuréen du Musée de la Résistance Nationale[46] (Nice)
  • Centre de la mémoire d'Oradour-sur-Glane, village martyr[47] (Oradour-sur-Glane)
  • Mémorial du Maréchal Leclerc de Hauteclocque et de la Libération de Paris et Musée Jean Moulin[48] (Paris)
  • Musée de l'Ordre de la Libération[49] (Paris)
  • Center of Contemporary Jewish Documentation & Mémorial de la Shoah (Paris)
  • Musée de la Résistance[50] (Peyrat-le-Château)
  • Musée de la reddition de Reims[51] (Reims)
  • Musée pyrénéen de la Résistance et de la Libération, dans l'Ariège[52] (Rimont)
  • Centre Historique de la Résistance en Drôme et de la Déportation de Romans[53] (Romans-sur-Isère)
  • Musée de la Résistance en Morvan[54] (Saint-Brisson)
  • Mémorial de la Résistance et de la Déportation de la Loire[55] (Saint-Étienne)
  • Musée de la Résistance bretonne[56] (Saint-Marcel)
  • Le Centre européen du Résistant déporté au Struthof[57] (Natzwiller)
  • Musée de la Résistance et de la Déportation[58] (Tarbes)
  • Musée de la Résistance et de la Déportation de Picardie[59] (Tergnier)
  • Musée Départemental de la Résistance[60] (Thônes (La Balme-de-Thuy))
  • Centre Régional Résistance et Liberté (Deux-Sèvres)[61] (Thouars)
  • Musée départemental de la Résistance et de la Déportation[62] (Toulouse)
  • Musée vauzélien de la Résistance Nationale (Nièvre)[63] (Varennes-Vauzelles)
  • Musée départemental de la déportation et de l'internement[64] (Varilhes)
  • Mémorial de la Résistance[65] (Vassieux-en-Vercors)
  • Musée de la Résistance (Rosine Perrier)[66] (Villargondran)

Germany[edit]

Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe (Berlin)
  • Holocaust Tower, Jewish Museum, Berlin
  • Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe (Berlin)
  • Memorial to the Homosexuals Persecuted under the National Socialist Regime (Berlin)
  • Memorial to the Sinti and Roma Victims of National Socialism (Berlin)
  • Französische Kapelle (de) (Soest)
  • Memorial to the Victims of National Socialist 'Euthanasia' Killings (German: Gedenk- und Informationsort für die Opfer der nationalsozialistischen »Euthanasie«-Morde)[67][a]
  • Stolperstein – Holocaust memorials all over Germany and in 21 further European countries
  • Topf & Söhne – Builders of the Auschwitz Ovens. Museum and Place of Remembrance (Erfurt)
  • European Holocaust Memorial (Landsberg am Lech)[70]

Greece[edit]

  • The Athens Holocaust Memorial – at the end of the pedestrian crossing, at the junction of Melidoni, Ermou and Efvoulou streets[71] (Athens)
  • Cemetery and Monument for the Victims of the Holocaust – 3rd Cemetery of Athens, Nikea, Piraeus
  • Holocaust memorial outside of the archaeological site of Kerameikos (Athens)
  • Jewish Museum of Greece – Shoah Exhibit[72] (Athens)
  • Jewish Museum of Thessaloniki – Shoah Exhibit[73] (Thessaloniki, Central Macedonia)
  • Monument of the Victims of the Holocaust in the Jewish Martyrs square,[74] (Rhodes)
  • Monument to Young Jews (dedicated to the memory of young Jews who died in the Holocaust) – Pafos Square, area of Kato Patissia, north of downtown Athens
  • Rhodes Jewish Museum[75] (Rhodes)
  • Holocaust Memorial of Corfu (dedicated to the memory of 2000 Jews of Corfu who perished in the Nazi concentration camps of Auschwitz and Birkenau in June 1944. Erected by the Municipality of Corfu and the Jewish community of Corfu in November 2001) – Xenophontos Stratigou, New Fortress Square, Corfu

Hungary[edit]

  • Holocaust Memorial Center[76]
  • Shoes on the Danube Bank-The memorial is of metal shoes on the edge of the Danube. The Jews were ordered to take off their shoes, and were shot at the edge of the water so that their bodies fell into the river and were carried away. It represents their shoes left behind on the bank. The Fascist Arrow Cross militiamen carried out the shootings. (Budapest)

Israel[edit]

Yad Vashem in Jerusalem
  • Yad Vashem, the Holocaust Martyrs' and Heroes' Remembrance Authority (Jerusalem)
  • Ghetto Fighters’ House Museum (in Kibbutz Lohamei HaGeta'ot, Ghetto Fighters' House)
  • Beit Theresienstadt, the Theresienstadt Martyrs Remembrance Association (in Kibbutz Givat Haim (Ihud))
  • Massuah Institute for the Study of the Holocaust (in Kibbutz Tel Yitzhak )
  • "From Holocaust to Revival Museum” (in Kibbutz Lohamei Yad Mordechai)
  • Kiryat Białystok (Archive and community center in Yehud)
  • Chamber of the Holocaust (Mount Zion, Jerusalem )
  • Ani Ma'amin Holocaust Museum (Jerusalem)
  • Forest of the Martyrs (Jerusalem)
  • LGBT Memorial to LGBT people persecuted by the Nazis Tel Aviv[77]
  • The sculpture garden of Holocaust to resurrection in Karmiel

Italy[edit]

  • Memoriale della Shoah (Milan, Italy)
  • Museo della Deportazione (Prato, Italy)
  • Museo della Shoah (Rome, Italy)
  • Museo Diffuso della Resistenza Torino[permanent dead link] (Torino, Italy)

Japan[edit]

  • Holocaust Education Center Fukuyuma, Japan http://www.urban.ne.jp/home/hecjpn/
  • Tokyo Holocaust Education Resource Center Tokyo, Japan

Latvia[edit]

  • Memorial complex at Rumbula
  • Memorial complex at Salaspils
  • Museum of Tolerance at the site of Kaiserwald
  • Museum "Jews in Latvia"
  • Riga ghetto and holocaust in Latvia museum

Macedonia[edit]

  • Holocaust Memorial Center for the Jews of Macedonia in Skopje, Macedonia

Mexico[edit]

  • The Tuvia Maizel Holocaust Museum in Mexico City, Mexico

Netherlands[edit]

  • The Anne Frank House (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
  • The Hollandsche Schouwburg (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
  • The Joods Historisch Museum (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
  • The Homomonument (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
  • The Westerbork camp and informationcentre (Westerbork, Netherlands)
  • Herzogenbusch concentration camp

Norway[edit]

  • Center for Studies of Holocaust and Religious Minorities (HL-senteret) (Oslo, Norway)

Poland[edit]

  • Auschwitz concentration camp, UNESCO World Heritage Site, Oświęcim
  • Auschwitz-Birkenau State Museum, Oświęcim
  • The Oświęcim Synagogue, Oświęcim
  • Bełżec extermination camp, Bełżec, Lublin Voivodeship
  • POLIN Museum of the History of Polish Jews, Warsaw
  • Radegast train station, Łódź
  • Treblinka extermination camp, Treblinka, Masovian Voivodeship

Russia[edit]

  • Holocaust Memorial Synagogue, Moscow
  • Russian Research and Educational Holocaust Center, Moscow

Serbia[edit]

Šumarice Memorial Park, Kragujevac
  • Memorial Park Jajinci, Belgrade
  • Šumarice Genocide Memorial Park, Kragujevac
  • Banjica concentration camp, Belgrade
  • Bubanj Memorial Park, Niš
  • Crveni Krst concentration camp, Niš
  • Museum og genocide victims, Belgrade http://www.muzejgenocida.rs/

Slovakia[edit]

  • Múzeum holokaustu a židovskej kultúry (Sereď)
  • SNM – Múzeum židovskej kultúry Bratislava (Bratislava)

South Africa[edit]

  • The Cape Town Holocaust Centre[78] (Cape Town, South Africa)
  • The Durban Holocaust Centre[79] (Durban, South Africa)
  • The Johannesburg Holocaust And Genocide Centre[80] (Johannesburg, South Africa)

Spain[edit]

  • Monument to the Victims of the Mauthausen Concentration Camp[81] (Almería)

Suriname[edit]

  • Paramaribo Holocaust Memorial Paramaribo, Suriname[82]

Sweden[edit]

  • Monument to the Memory of the Holocaust Victims, the Great Synagogue of Stockholm[83] (Stockholm)
  • Forum för levande historia – The Living History Forum is a Swedish public authority which, using the Holocaust and other crimes against humanity as a starting point, works with issues on tolerance, democracy and human rights.[84]
  • The new entrance and annex of the theatre Storsjöteatern in Östersund is built to architecturally honour the Holocaust memorial in Berlin.[85]

Ukraine[edit]

  • Ukrainian Institute for Holocaust Studies (Dnepropetrovsk) http://tkuma.dp.ua/index.php/en/
  • Babi Yar Holocaust Memorial Center (Kiev)

United Kingdom[edit]

Holocaust Memorial in Hyde Park, London
  • Beth Shalom Holocaust Centre (Nottinghamshire, England)
  • The Imperial War Museum Holocaust Exhibition in London
  • The Wiener Library for the Study of the Holocaust and Genocide (London)
  • The Hyde Park Holocaust memorial, in Hyde Park, London.
  • The memorial at the Church of St Michael the Greater, Stamford.

United States[edit]

Main article: List of Holocaust memorials and museums in the United States
Holocaust Memorial for the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Harrisburg, Pennsylvania by David Ascalon (1994)

Uruguay[edit]

  • Memorial del Holocausto del Pueblo Judío[86] (Montevideo, Uruguay)

See also[edit]

  • Association of Holocaust Organizations
  • Holocaust
  • Holocaust museum
  • Holocaust victims
  • Culture of Remembrance

Related[edit]

  • List of Armenian Genocide memorials
  • List of Holocaust memorials and museums in the United States
  • List of Holodomor memorials and museums

Notes[edit]

  1. ^ The German national memorial to the people with disabilities systematically murdered by the Nazis was dedicated in 2014 in Berlin.[68][69] It is located in Berlin in a site next to the Tiergarten park, which is the former location of a villa at Tiergartenstrasse 4 where more than 60 Nazi bureaucrats and doctors worked in secret under the "T4" program to organize the mass murder of sanatorium and psychiatric hospital patients deemed unworthy to live.[69]
